column4: But I thought when you used sudo, you are using the root?, no?
sudo is a 'system' that lets users do some 'root privilage' actions. or it can let users run things as other users.
thers mor to 'sudo' then 'doing things as root'
sudo uses the USERS password - correct.
but should there be a seperate pass for the root?
so there are things I cannot do in root?
as you are shutting down befor the pc powers off? not a big issue.. just how the card/memory is getting reset/displayed i imagine
It is a normal shut down, happens everytime
quirk of the video drivers/card. ivbe seen it on a few box's
I have another thing, when I boot up I get "ACPI: expecting a [reference] package element, found type 0"
Does not stop boot process, just looks funky
just a warning about somthing.. not woth worrying about.
Firefox 3.5 is still in beta for ubuntu right?
thats what im hearing.
any terminal app can be used to do ssh.
ssh it a 'remote shell' unless you mean 'sftp' or somthing else..
I want to use ssh, but want a gui client
a gui client to do what exactly? You type in  shell commands once you make a 'ssh' connection.. so   im not sure what you are really wanting.
I want to be able to drag files over, not just type the file names
then you want a 'sftp' client. Not a 'ssh' client
and most file managers can do sftp.
yes i know that
I want to be able to transfer files for web dev work
i belive the gnome   connext --> to server. has a web dav option.. or it can connect via ssh/sftp and put an icon on your desktop
